pr_title: Secure password for monitoring HTTP exporter

timeline.bodyText: there is an assumption that all the settings here are dynamic cluster settings.
timeline.author: albertzaharovits

replies.bodyText: Ah, that explains it. Thank you, @albertzaharovits.
replies.author: danhermann

timeline.message: handle deprecation warnings in integration tests

timeline.bodyText: Can you use a ConcurrentHashMap instead of explicit synchronization ?  perhaps : https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/ConcurrentHashMap.html#replace-K-V- ?
timeline.author: jakelandis

replies.bodyText: I tried using ConcurrentHashMap to avoid explicit locking but ConcurrentHashMap::replace() works only if there is an existing entry for the specified key. I need the K-V entry to be set whether there was an existing entry or not.
replies.author: danhermann

replies.bodyText: Simple ConcurrentHashMap::put() should work here - it does return previous value and sets entry whether there was one before or not
replies.author: probakowski

replies.bodyText: Ah, right, that will work here.
replies.author: danhermann

timeline.bodyText: If you use a ConcurrentHashMap for SECURE_AUTH_PASSWORDS you should be able to use getOrDefault instead of explicit synchronization.
timeline.author: jakelandis

timeline.bodyText:
Passwords as String should be avoided where possible due to help avoid leaking to heap since gc happens when ever it feel like it. I think you can use SecureString instead and then close it out to ensure it zero'd out when you are done.
Also since it looks like you are using this for equality, can you just hash it and store the hash in the map ?
timeline.author: jakelandis

replies.author: danhermann

timeline.bodyText: Can you leave a quick comment here (maybe with a GH issue link?) to why you can not validate the password is set ?
timeline.author: jakelandis
jakelandis

timeline.bodyText: Do plugins get reloaded when the secure settings change ?
timeline.author: jakelandis

replies.bodyText: Plugins that implement ReloadablePlugin have their reload methods called any time the reload_secure_settings endpoint is called.
replies.author: danhermann

timeline.bodyText:
Could you add some unit tests for changing the secure setting and ensure it is changed (or no-op) as well as trying to set this for a non-http type setting ? See org.elasticsearch.xpack.watcher.notification.NotificationService for some examples.
Ideally, we would also have Integration tests, but I didn't see any framework already setup to read from the keystore for a Integration tests (and an almost complete lack of Rest tests) :(
timeline.author: jakelandis

timeline.message: integration test that reloads secure password
log warning if both secure password and deprecated password are supplied
add link from reloadable settings page to monitoring settings page
